      • resizeImage

        public static java.awt.Image resizeImage(java.awt.Image image,
                         int width,
                         int height,
                         boolean max)
        This method resizes the given image using Image.SCALE_SMOOTH.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be resized
        width - the desired width of the new image. Negative values force the only constraint to be height.
        height - the desired height of the new image. Negative values force the only constraint to be width.
        max - if true, sets the width and height as maximum heights and widths, if false, they are minimums.
        Returns:
        the resized image.

      • resizeImageBy

        public static java.awt.Image resizeImageBy(java.awt.Image image,
                           int size,
                           boolean setWidth)
        Resizes the given image using Image.SCALE_SMOOTH.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be resized
        size - the size to resize the width/height by (see setWidth)
        setWidth - whether the size applies to the height or to the width
        Returns:
        the resized image

      • resizeImageFromFile

        public static java.awt.Image resizeImageFromFile(java.lang.String location,
                                 int width,
                                 int height,
                                 boolean max)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Convenience method. Creates a BufferedImage from the given file location and returns resizeImage(image, width, height, max).
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the image
        width - the desired width of the new image. Negative values force the only constraint to be height.
        height - the desired height of the new image. Negative values force the only constraint to be width.
        max - if true, sets the width and height as maximum heights and widths, if false, they are minimums.
        Returns:
        the resized image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when trying to load a file from the given location

      • resizeImageFromFileBy

        public static java.awt.Image resizeImageFromFileBy(java.lang.String location,
                                   int size,
                                   boolean setWidth)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Resizes the given image using Image.SCALE_SMOOTH.
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the image
        size - the size to resize the width/height by (see setWidth)
        setWidth - whether the size applies to the height or to the width
        Returns:
        the resized image
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when loading the image from the file

      • resizeImageFromResource

        public static java.awt.Image resizeImageFromResource(java.lang.Class klass,
                                     java.lang.String location,
                                     int width,
                                     int height,
                                     boolean max)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Convenience method. Creates a BufferedImage from the given resource location (respective to the given class) and returns resizeImage(image, width, height, max).
        Parameters:
        klass - the class to get the resource from
        location - the location of the resource respective to the class
        width - the desired width of the new image. Negative values force the only constraint to be height.
        height - the desired height of the new image. Negative values force the only constraint to be width.
        max - if true, sets the width and height as maximum heights and widths, if false, they are minimums.
        Returns:
        the resized image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • resizeImageFromResourceBy

        public static java.awt.Image resizeImageFromResourceBy(java.lang.Class klass,
                                       java.lang.String location,
                                       int size,
                                       boolean setWidth)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Resizes the given image using Image.SCALE_SMOOTH.
        Parameters:
        klass - the class to get the resource relative of
        location - the location of the resource to be resized
        size - the size to resize the width/height by (see setWidth)
        setWidth - whether the size applies to the height or to the width
        Returns:
        the resized image
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when reading the resource

      • addImage

        public static void addImage(java.awt.Container container,
            java.awt.Image image,
            boolean setWidth,
            int size,
            int anchor,
            boolean bottom)
        Adds a given image to the specified side of the given container
        Parameters:
        container - where you want the image
        image - the image to add
        setWidth - if true will set the width as the given size, if false, will set the height as the given size
        size - 0 - 4 is smallest to biggest
        anchor - use java.awt.GridBagConstraints.CENTER (for example)
        bottom - if true, image will appear on the bottom, if false, image will appear on the right.

      • addImageFromFile

        public static void addImageFromFile(java.awt.Container container,
                    java.lang.String location,
                    boolean setWidth,
                    int size,
                    int anchor,
                    boolean bottom)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Convenience method.
        Parameters:
        container - where you want the image
        location - the location of the file
        setWidth - if true will set the width as the given size, if false, will set the height as the given size
        size - 0 - 4 is smallest to biggest
        anchor - use java.awt.GridBagConstraints.CENTER (for example)
        bottom - if true, image will appear on the bottom, if false, image will appear on the right.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addImageFromResource

        public static void addImageFromResource(java.lang.Class klass,
                        java.awt.Container container,
                        java.lang.String location,
                        boolean setWidth,
                        int size,
                        int anchor,
                        boolean bottom)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Convenience method.
        Parameters:
        klass - the class to get the resource from
        container - where you want the image
        location - the location of the resource with respect to the given class
        setWidth - if true will set the width as the given size, if false, will set the height as the given size
        size - 0 - 4 is smallest to biggest
        anchor - use java.awt.GridBagConstraints.CENTER (for example)
        bottom - if true, image will appear on the bottom, if false, image will appear on the right.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getProgressWheelWindow

        public static javax.swing.JWindow getProgressWheelWindow(javax.swing.Icon icon,
                                         java.lang.Float opacity,
                                         int x,
                                         int y)
        Returns a window with a partially opaque progress Icon. Sets the opacity, location and size (to the given icon size) (does not pack the image)
        Parameters:
        icon - the icon to set in the progress window
        opacity - a float value from 0-1
        x - the x location of the window
        y - the y location of the window
        Returns:
        a jWindow of the progress wheel

      • getProgressWheelWindow

        public static javax.swing.JWindow getProgressWheelWindow(javax.swing.Icon icon)
        Convenience method. Returns a window with a partially opaque progress Icon in the center of the screen
        Parameters:
        icon - the icon to set in the progress window
        Returns:
        a jWindow of the progress wheel

      • chooseFolder

        public static java.lang.String chooseFolder(java.lang.String startingPath,
                            java.awt.Component parent,
                            java.lang.String title,
                            java.awt.Dimension dimension)
        Opens a JFolderChooser of the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        startingPath - The selected file path will be assigned to this String.
        parent - of the JFolderChooser
        title - of the JFolderChooser
        dimension - of the JFolderChooser
        Returns:
        the selected path. Returns null if the user did not activate the approve option (closed the window or clicked "Cancel")

      • wordWrappedMessage

        public static java.lang.String wordWrappedMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Convenience Method: Calls StringHelper.wordWrappedMessage(message, getWordWrapChars()). A method like this allows you to keep everything standard for JOptionPane messages
        Parameters:
        message -
        Returns:

      • showErrorMessage

        public static void showErrorMessage(java.awt.Component parent,
                    java.lang.String message)
        Shows an error message with the given message. Calls wordWrappedMessage(message). The title and the content have preset text.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent for the JOptionPane
        message - the message for the error

      • showNumberInputErrorMessage

        public static void showNumberInputErrorMessage(java.awt.Component parent,
                               boolean decimal)
        Shows an error message with a preset message. Adds decimal if decimal is true
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent for the JOptionPane
        decimal - whether to include a decimal in the message

      • getWordWrapChars

        public static int getWordWrapChars()
        Returns:
        the wordWrapChars. This is the number of characters to wrap JOptionPane messages with when you call wordWrappedMessage(String message)

      • setWordWrapChars

        public static void setWordWrapChars(int aWordWrapChars)
        Parameters:
        aWordWrapChars - the wordWrapChars to set. This is the number of characters to wrap JOptionPane messages with when you call wordWrappedMessage(String message)
